content.description: This short and sweet route is likely the best possible climb on the south side of The Carousel - it goes straight up the thin head-level undercling.  Many variations are possible, though a fun one is to keep both hands in the undercling and work feet up, from here pop up to a crimp and top out.
content.location: The undercling where the trail hits the boulder on the south side.  (Not the sit start undercling on the east side, or the knee high juggy undercling more left.)

climbs.name: no name: i'll call it 'two hands in the hole'

content.description:
step up to reach the triangular hole, match hands and a foot, sloper options and finish with a mantle.

how you do it is up to you, but i love that sequence.

falling without a pad is pretty pleasant, there's plenty of room on this side of the boulder to roll out of a bail. (if you're old skool and just bring shoes and a carpet)
content.location: north side of carosel, the triangular hole is a dead give away

content.description:
start with the undercling, plenty of crimps and sidepulls to follow.

the first foot is a bit slick, if you see blood trickling from someone's shin...they've been working this problem.
content.location: where the trail hits the boulder, unmistakable undercling on the left of the not-so-wide face.

content.description: Step up onto the large, knee-high edge and grab the big diagonal jug on the right. From here it's all smedging on small feet with one good left hand hold and a fun top-out.
content.location: Just left of center on the north side of the boulder.

content.description: Start at the northwest arete of the Carousel boulder. Traverse left all the way around staying low and passing several thin cruxes along the way.
Route is just to the right of the corner problem on the north face of carousel. This is a tiny crimp problem, Don’t use the large holds on left and right… Edge your way to the top out.
